name: Morning briefing
prompt:
Step 1: Gather activity from the last 24 hours in this repository:
  - Run: git log --since="24 hours ago" --oneline --stat
  - Run: gh pr list --state all --search "updated:>$(date -u -v-1d +%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S)" --json number,title,state,author,updatedAt
  - Run: gh issue list --state all --search "updated:>$(date -u -v-1d +%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S)" --json number,title,state,author,updatedAt
  - Check CI status: gh run list --limit 10 --json status,conclusion,name,createdAt

Step 2: Check if any direct dependencies released new versions in the last 24h:
  - Read package.json (or requirements.txt, Cargo.toml, go.mod as appropriate)
  - For key dependencies, check their latest release: gh api repos/{owner}/{repo}/releases/latest

Step 3: Compile a concise briefing (max 30 lines):
  - Commits: count + 1-line summary of notable changes
  - PRs: opened, merged, closed
  - Issues: opened, closed
  - CI: any failures? what broke?
  - Dependency alerts: any new releases worth noting?

Step 4: Output the briefing to stdout. If nothing happened, say "All quiet â€” no activity in the last 24 hours."
system_prompt: You are a concise project briefing assistant. Report facts, not opinions. Keep it under 30 lines. Use plain text, no markdown headers. If nothing happened, say so in one line.
